original: Feathers are among the most important pieces of evidence in forensic ornithology. Each bird species possesses distinct feather characteristics that can be observed at both macroscopic and microscopic levels. These characteristics include size, shape, color, and pattern, as well as the arrangement and structure of barbs and barbules. By analyzing these features, forensic ornithologists can accurately determine the species of a feather.
